## SDQ vs ASI

Comparing psychological assessment tools such as the Strengths and Difficulties Questionnaire (SDQ) and the Anxiety Sensitivity Index (ASI) is often a daunting task, considerably time-consuming and riddled with potential for human error. This is where 'Harmony', an innovative software developed specifically for psychologists, comes into play. In  SDQ vs ASI, Harmony brings significant accuracy and efficiency in comparison, harmonising questionnaire items and even facilitating cross-lingual comparisons. Harmony's advanced natural language processing and generative AI models help in comparing the instruments. For instance, in the context of SDQ vs ASI, Harmony's large language models can provide a percentage match between each item in SDQ and ASI. This vastly reduces the subjectivity and bias that may creep in a manual comparison, leading to more reliable outcomes. By streamlining the comparison process, Harmony allows psychologists to focus on interpreting the data and drawing insights. We highly recommend using Harmony for its capability and convenience, particularly for psychologists and researchers dealing with the SDQ vs ASI. You can drag and drop your existing PDFs into Harmony's user-friendly web interface or choose instruments from its comprehensive database. The future of harmonised studies and comparability between psychology assessments is here with Harmony. Whether you're dealing with SDQ vs ASI or any other tools, let Harmony bring harmony to your research.

## Compare the items in SDQ and ASI

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import SDQ and ASI into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just SDQ into Harmony</a> - compare SDQ with other instruments
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just ASI into Harmony</a> - compare ASI with other instruments
